AVSEC CIRCULAR  NO.  09  / 2012 
 
 
Subject :   Instructions on use of Satellite Telephone Services in India. 
 
 
 
  Satellite telephone services are not being permitted in India, however, 
handsets of Thuraya, Irridium and other such satellite operators have been found  to be 
in use in an unauthorized way. There are instances where these Thuraya sets are being 
used by foreign nationals reportedly out of ignorance regarding ban on usage of such 
phones in India. The unauthorized use of such sets has serious security implications. 
Therefore, whenever Thuraya Sets are detected to be in use, they should be seized and 
the holder can be prosecuted under Section 6 of Indian Wireless Act and Section 20 of 
Indian Telegraph Act.  
 
2. 
  All concerned may be sensitized towards this aspect of security threat and 
people found to be making unauthorized use of Thuraya / Irridium Sets etc. may be 
prosecuted as per law. Adequate publicity may also be made at airports about the 
restrictions on the usage of satphones in the country.  
 
 
  This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA).  
 
 
 
 
 ( R.N.Dhoke, IPS )  
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA)
